(d) Based on your answer to part (c), if the nominal interest rate is the same for both countries in Year <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, which country experiences the higher real interest rate in Year <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Explain.

(e) Assume loans in Clarendon were made taking into account an expected inflation rate of <math alttext="15%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>15</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. Will borrowers in Clarendon be better off, worse off, or not affected after they realize the actual inflation rate calculated in part (c)(i)? Explain.
